gw.plugin.messaging

Interface MessageTransport

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, MessagePlugin, java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEmailMessageTransport

    public interface MessageTransport
extends MessagePlugin
    Plugin interface implemented to dispatch an integration message to an external system. Used in conjunction with MessageRequest (for message pre- and post-processing) and MessageReply (for asynchronous message lookup and ack).
    Author:
    jseybold

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void send(Message message, java.lang.String transformedPayload)
      Send the message.

      • Methods inherited from interface gw.plugin.messaging.MessagePlugin

        resume, setDestinationID, shutdown, suspend

    • Method Detail

      • send

        void send(Message message,
        java.lang.String transformedPayload)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Send the message. The plugin may optionally ack the message and update any fields; changes to the message and any other modified beans will be persisted after the send method completes (and after the MessageRequest plugin has completed work in its afterSend() method). The transformedPayload parameter is set to the String returned from the Request plugin's beforeSend() method. By default, if no Request plugin is defined for the destination, the transformedPayload is set to be equal to the original Message payload. If the beforeSend() in the MessageRequest plugin changes the message status, the send() method will not be called.

        Exceptions will cause the send operation (including another call to Request.beforeSend()) to be retried until retries are exhausted.

        Parameters:
        message - The message to send
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
